title: rRNA formation in Prokaryotes and Eukaryotes

content.description: All cells must transcribe <math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in order to construct a functioning ribosome. Scientists have isolated and identified <math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> genes that contribute to ribosomal structure for both prokaryotes and eukaryotes. Figure 1 compares the transcription and processing of prokaryotic and eukaryotic <math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Figure 1. Comparison of <math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></math> processing in prokaryotes and eukaryotes Which of the following statements provides the best explanation of the processes illustrated in Figure 1 ?

choices.label: Introns are removed from the pre-<math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the mature <math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are joined and then translated to produce the protein portion of the ribosome.

Introns are removed from the pre-<math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and each mature <math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecule is translated to produce the proteins that make up the ribosomal subunits.

Sections of the pre-<math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are removed, and the mature <math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are available to combine with proteins to form the ribosomal subunits.

Sections of the pre-<math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are removed, and the mature <math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are available to bring different amino acids to the ribosome.

content.answer: Sections of the pre-<math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are removed, and the mature <math alttext="r R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are available to combine with proteins to form the ribosomal subunits.
